Standard_Text: Identify how art is used to inform or change beliefs, values, or behaviors of an individual or society.

Standard_Text: Interpret art by analyzing characteristics of form and structure, contextual information, subject matter, visual elements, and use of media to identify ideas and mood conveyed.

Standard_Text: Develop a logical argument for safe and effective use of materials and techniques for preparing and presenting artwork.

Standard_Text: Use art vocabulary to describe personal choices in artmaking and in creating artist statements.

Standard_Text: Identify, describe, and visually document places and/or objects of personal significance.

Standard_Text: Demonstrate quality craftsmanship through care for and use of materials, tools, and equipment
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Experiment and develop skills in multiple art-making techniques and approaches through practice.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Identify and demonstrate diverse methods of artistic investigation to choose an approach for beginning a work of art.

Standard_Text: Combine ideas to generate an innovative idea for art-making.

Standard_Text:
Connect and demonstrate
the relationships between
music and societal, cultural,
and historical contexts when
creating, performing, and
responding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Connect and demonstrate
how personal interests,
knowledge, and skills relate
to choices and intent when
creating, performing, and
responding to music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply teacher provided and established
criteria based on personal
preference, analysis, and
context (personal, social,
and cultural) to evaluate
individual and small group
musical selections.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain and support
possible interpretations
of the expressive intent
and meaning of musical
selections, citing as evidence
the treatment of the
elements of music, context
(personal, social, and
cultural), (when applicable)
the setting of the text, and
outside sources.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare passages in
musical selections and
explain how the elements of
music and context (social,
cultural, or historical) inform
the response.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply criteria to select
music for specified purposes,
supporting choices by citing
characteristics found in
the music and connections
to interest, purpose, and
context (social, cultural, and
historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform with expression
and technical accuracy,
in individual and small
group performances, a
varied repertoire of music
that includes melodies,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns, demonstrating
sensitivity to the audience
and an understanding of the
context (social, cultural, or
historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply criteria
to critique individual and
small group performances
of a varied repertoire of
music that includes melodies,
improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments
in a variety of patterns, and
create rehearsal strategies
to address performance
challenges and refine the
performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe in interpretations
the context (social, cultural,
or historical) and expressive
intent in a varied repertoire
of music selected for
performance that includes
melodies, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in
a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify and describe
important theoretical and
structural characteristics
and context (social,
cultural, or historical) in a
varied repertoire of music
that includes melodies,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain the criteria used
when selecting a varied
repertoire of music for
individual or small group
performances that include
melodies, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in
a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform final versions of
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more
chord accompaniments
in a variety of patterns,
demonstrating technical
skill in applying principles of
composition/improvisation
and originality in developing
and organizing musical ideas.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply criteria
to critique, improve, and
refine drafts of improvisations,
compositions and three or more chord accompaniments
in a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select, develop, and use
standard notation and audio/
video recording to document
melodic, rhythmic, and
harmonic ideas for drafts of
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more chord
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Generate melodic, rhythmic,
and harmonic ideas for
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more chord
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain and
demonstrate
connections
between music and
societal, cultural,
and historical
contexts.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Musicians connect societal, cultural, and historical contexts when creating, performing, and responding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain and
demonstrate how
personal interests,
experiences, ideas,
and knowledge
relate to creating,
performing, and
responding to music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Musicians connect their personal interests, experiences, ideas, and knowledge to creating, performing, and
responding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Evaluate musical
works and
performances,
applying established
criteria, and explain
appropriateness to
the context, citing
evidence from the
elements of music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
The personal evaluation of musical work(s) and performance(s) is informed by analysis, interpretation, and
established criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
and explain how
expressive qualities
(such as dynamics,
tempo, timbre, and
articulation) are used
in performers’ personal
interpretations to
reflect creators’
expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Through their use of elements and structures of music, creators and performers provide clues to their expressive
intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate and
explain, citing
evidence, how
responses to music
are informed by the
structure, the use
of the elements of
music, and context
(such as personal,
social, cultural, and
historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Response to music is informed by analyzing context (social, cultural, and historical) and how creators and
performers manipulate the elements of music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate and
explain, citing
evidence, how
selected music
connects to and
is influenced by
specific interests,
experiences,
purposes, or
contexts.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Individuals’ selection of musical works is influenced by their interests, experiences, understandings, and purposes.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
performance
decorum and
audience etiquette
appropriate for
the context, venue,
genre, and style.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform music,
alone or with others,
with expression,
technical accuracy,
and appropriate
interpretation.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Musicians judge performance based on criteria that vary across time, place, and cultures. The context and how a
work is presented influence audience response.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Rehearse to
refine technical
accuracy and
expressive qualities
to address
challenges and
show improvement
over time.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply teacher-provided and
established criteria
and feedback
to evaluate the
accuracy and
expressiveness
of ensemble
and personal
performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
To express their musical ideas, musicians analyze, evaluate, and refine their performance over time through
openness to new ideas, persistence, and the application of appropriate criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
and explain how
intent is conveyed
through interpretive
decisions and
expressive qualities
(such as dynamics,
tempo, timbre, and
articulation/style).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performers make interpretive decisions based on their understanding of context and expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain how
context (such as
personal, social,
cultural, and
historical) informs
performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
When analyzing
selected music,
read and perform
using standard
notation.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
understanding of
the structure and
the elements of
music (such as
rhythm, pitch, form,
and harmony) in
music selected for
performance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyzing creators’ context and how they manipulate elements of music provides insight into their intent and
informs performance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
and explain how
the selection of
music to perform
is influenced by
personal interest,
knowledge, and
context, as well as
their personal and
others’ technical
skill.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Performers’ interest in and knowledge of musical works, understanding of their own technical skill, and the
context for a performance influence the selection of repertoire.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Present the final
version of personal
created music
to others that
demonstrates
craftsmanship and
explain connection
to expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Musicians’ presentation of creative work is the culmination of a process of creation and communication.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Evaluate, refine, and
document revisions
to personal music,
applying teacher-provided and
collaboratively
developed criteria
and feedback, and
explain rationale for
changes.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Musicians evaluate and refine their work through openness to new ideas, persistence, and the application of
appropriate criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use standard
and/or iconic
notation and/
or recording
technology to
document personal
rhythmic, melodic,
and two-chord
harmonic musical
ideas.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
selected and
developed
musical ideas for
improvisations,
arrangements, or
compositions to
express intent, and
explain connection to
purpose and context.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Musicians’ creative choices are influenced by their expertise, context, and expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Generate musical
ideas (such as
rhythms, melodies,
and accompaniment

tonalities, meters,
and simple chord
changes.

Standard_Text:
Improvise
rhythmic, melodic,
and harmonic
ideas, and explain
connection to
specific purpose
and context (such
as social, cultural,
and historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: The creative ideas, concepts, and feelings that influence musicians’ work emerge from a variety of sources.

Examine, discuss, and

Research and show
how media artworks

Context to Deepen Understanding

Examine and

Standard_Text:
Access and

experiences, to

artworks.

basic criteria

and improving
media artworks
and production
processes,
considering context.

Standard_Text:
Determine and
explain reactions
and interpretations
to a variety of

considering their

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify, describe,

Standard_Text:
Identify, describe,
and differentiate
how messages
and meaning

media artworks.

Compare qualities
and purposes

formats, associated

for presentation of

Practice
fundamental

experimental use of
tools, in addressing
problems within and
through media arts
productions.

Enact various
roles to practice

and collaboration,
in media arts
productions.

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Create media
artworks through
the integration of
multiple contents
and forms.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Producing

Standard_Text:
Determine how
elements and
components can
be altered for clear
communication and
intentional effects,
and refine media
artworks to improve
clarity and purpose.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Create content
and combine
components to
convey expression,
purpose, and
meaning in a variety
of media arts
productions, utilizing
sets of associated
aesthetic principles,
such as emphasis
and exaggeration.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop, present,
and test ideas,
plans, models,
and/or proposals
for media arts
productions,
considering the
artistic goals and
audience.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Envision original
ideas and
innovations for
media artworks
using personal
experiences and the
work of others.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe how
the movement
characteristics
and qualities
of a dance in a
specific genre or
style communicate
the ideas and
perspectives
of the culture,
historical period, or
community from
which the genre or
style originated.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Choose a topic,
concept, or content
from another
discipline of study
and research how
other art forms have
expressed the topic.
Create a dance
study that expresses
the idea. Explain
how the dance
study expressed the
idea and discuss
how this learning
process is similar
to, or different
from, other learning
situations.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare two
dances with
contrasting themes.
Discuss feelings
and ideas evoked by
each. Describe how
the themes and
movements relate to
points of view and
experiences.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
and discuss the
characteristics of
dance that make
a dance artistic
and meaningful.
Relate them to the
elements of dance
in genres, styles, or
cultural movement
practices. Use basic
dance terminology
to describe
characteristics of
the dance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Interpret meaning
in a dance based
on its movements.
Explain how
the movements
communicate the
main idea of the
dance using basic
dance terminology.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe, using
basic dance
terminology, the
qualities and
characteristics of
style used in a dance
from one’s own
cultural movement
practice. Compare
them to the qualities
and characteristics
of style found in a
different dance genre,
style, or cultural
movement practice.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Find meaning
or artistic intent
from the patterns
of movement in a
dance work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify, explore,
and select
production elements
that heighten and
intensify the artistic
intent of a dance
and are adaptable
for various
performance spaces.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
the ability to adapt
dance to alternative
performance venues
by modifying
spacing and
movements to the
performance space.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Collaborate with
peer ensemble
members to
repeat sequences,
synchronize actions,
and refine spatial
relationships
to improve
performance quality.
Apply feedback
from others to
establish personal
performance goals.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
safe body-use
practices during
technical exercises
and movement
combinations.
Discuss how these
practices, along
with healthful eating
habits, promote
strength, flexibility,
endurance, and
injury prevention.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Recall and
execute a series
of dance phrases
using technical
dance skills
(e.g., alignment,
coordination,
balance, core
support, clarity of
movement).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Contrast bound
and free flowing
movements. Initiate
movements from a
variety of points of
the body. Analyze
the relationship
between initiation
and energy.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Dance to a
variety of rhythms
generated from
internal and
external sources.
Perform movement
phrases that show
the ability to
respond to changes
in time.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Integrate static
and dynamic
shapes as well
as floor and air
pathways into
dance sequences.
Establish
relationships with
other dancers with
intentionality and
focus. Convert
inward focus to
outward focus.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Revise movement
based on peer
feedback and selfreflection to improve
communication
of artistic intent
in a short dance
study. Explain and
document choices
made in the process.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop a dance
study by selecting a
specific movement
vocabulary to
communicate a
main idea. Discuss
how the dance
communicates
nonverbally.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Manipulate or
modify a variety
of choreographic
devices to expand
choreographic
possibilities and
develop a main idea.
Explain reasons for
movement choices.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Construct and
solve multiple
movement problems
to develop
choreographic
content.

Standard_Text:
Build content
for choreography
using several stimuli
(e.g., music/sound,
text, objects, images,
notation, observed
dance, experiences,
literary forms, natural
phenomena, current
news, social events).

sources that explain

terminology and
conventions.

Analyze
commonalities
and differences
between stories set

in preparation for a

Standard_Text:
Explore
the ethical
responsibilities to
oneself and others
when observing and

Investigate
historical, global,
and social issues
expressed in drama/
theatre work.

Standard_Text:
Explain how
drama/theatre
connects oneself
to a community or
culture.

technical theatre
elements represent
the theme of a
drama/theatre work.

Standard_Text:
Analyze and
evaluate a character’s
circumstances in a
drama/theatre work
from an audience
perspective.

Standard_Text:
Develop multiple
criteria to evaluate
drama/theatre work.

Standard_Text:
Investigate the
effects of emotions
on posture, gesture,

vocal intonation in a
drama/theatre work.

Standard_Text:
Explain responses
to characters based
on cultural contexts
when participating
in or observing
drama/theatre work.

Standard_Text:
Justify responses
based on personal
experiences when
participating in or
observing a drama/
theatre work.

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain personal
reactions to artistic
choices made in
a drama/theatre
work through
participation and
observation.

Use physical

Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Create innovative
solutions to design
and technical
theatre element
problems that arise
in rehearsal for a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use physical and
vocal exploration
for character
development in a
devised or scripted
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Revise and refine
an improvised or
scripted drama/
theatre work
through rehearsal,
collaborative review,
and reflection.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Participate
in defined
responsibilities
required to present
a drama/theatre
work informally to
an audience.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Devise original
ideas for a drama/
theatre work that
reflect collective
inquiry about
characters and their
given circumstances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Propose design
ideas that support
the story and given
circumstances in a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Imagine how a
character’s inner
thoughts impact
the story and given
circumstances in a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify physical
qualities that might
reveal a character’s
inner traits in the
imagined world of a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)
